meanings.sent1: Before taking the photo, I like to prefocusing the camera to make sure the image is clear.
meanings.sent2: She always prefocusing her mind before starting a new project to stay organized.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to be prefocusing on where to hide its acorn stash.
meanings.sent4: Like a skilled archer, he prefocusing his attention on the target before releasing the arrow.
meanings.sent5: Prefocusing on the task at hand can help improve productivity and efficiency.

meanings.definition: The act of focusing (something) in advance.
meanings.sent1: Prefocusing is essential in photography to ensure the image is sharp and clear.
meanings.sent2: His prefocusing of the presentation helped him deliver a flawless speech.
meanings.sent3: The prefocusing of the telescope allowed for a clear view of the distant galaxy.
meanings.sent4: The prefocusing of the microscope revealed intricate details of the tiny specimen.
meanings.sent5: Prefocusing before the exam helped calm her nerves and improve her performance.
